body:
> Can we remove the need to sklearnWrapper ?

Yes! You make me realize that it would be possible to automatically detect the class and use the wrapper to wrap sklearn objects only inside the Pipeline! 

> 2. what about OneHotEncoder or clustering whicj needs a state ?

Can you be more clear?

2) data processing can be just a function.
Do we need to wrap them into class with fit_transform ?






> On Oct 29, 2019, at 1:28, Guillaume Chevalier <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> ﻿
> Can we remove the need to sklearnWrapper ?
> 
> I realize it would be possible to automatically detect the class and use the wrapper to wrap sklearn objects only inside the Pipeline!
> 
> what about OneHotEncoder or clustering whicj needs a state ?
> Can you be more clear?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.

@arita37 we recommend that the data processing objects be wrapped as classes with fit, fit_transform, and transform functions. If it only transforms without fitting, you can code an object that does not need to fit, see this example here: 
https://www.neuraxio.com/en/neuraxle/stable/examples/non_fittable_mixin.html#sphx-glr-examples-non-fittable-mixin-py

It makes sense, allows to store the state (ie cateogory encoding).
As this package is in development phase, suggest to reduce :
   1) at the minimum, the amount of boilerplate code... code needed for users.
   2) The need to wrap too much the existing library (ie skleanrwrapper,...)

B) Why not ?
     pipeline( [   ], framework="sklearn", ...)

C) Am working on JSON TO Script code mapper :
https://github.com/arita37/json_api/blob/master/mapper_sklearn.py
using JSON as a language to setup batch compute (framework agnostic).

It can be useful to integrate in some way in current part of neuraxle.



D) You should check mlflow
https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.tensorflow.html

@arita37 Thanks. Here are my answers: 

> 1. at the minimum, the amount of boilerplate code... code needed for users.

Would you have more ideas for that? What would you like to see?

Note: If your pipeline step doesn't use the GPU, then most of the time you don't really need `setup` and `teardown`, and it's possible to just do `fit` and `transform` in your class. This is really interesting. And with the NonFIttableMixin, you can avoid doing `fit` if there is no state to acquire. State is acquired in fit. Then transform only processes. 

> 2. The need to wrap too much the existing library (ie skleanrwrapper,...)

Thank you for this good idea, we will take care of that. 

> B) Why not ? `Pipeline( [ ], framework="sklearn", ...)`

I think there is a simpler way to do it in 1, and for 2 it is possible to convert it again back as follow:

1. If you want to avoid to use the sklearn wrapper, we plan to add `if isinstance(step, sklearn.BaseEstimator): step = SKLearnWrapper(step)` inside the `__init__` of `Pipeline`. This way you will not even need to do `Pipeline( [ ], framework="sklearn", ...)` because it will convert the steps automatically. 
2. If you want to use the Neuraxle pipeline for scikit-learn, you can already do `Pipeline( [ ] ).tosklearn()` to convert it to a sklearn object. 

> C) Am working on JSON TO Script code mapper :

We love contributors. Could you please explain what your code do with more details? 

I looked rapidly and it seems like it would be useful. Can you provide more details? 

Note: we have an example here that show how to parse JSON to convert it to `X` and `y`: 
https://www.neuraxio.com/en/neuraxle/stable/rest_api_serving.html

> D) You should check mlflow

What would you suggest us to do with mlflow? Do you have ideas? What would be important to you?

Hello,
Thanks

1) My remarks were related to the amount 
of code needed to move from existing code
To Neuraxle.
Less code needed is better for quick conversion and maintenance.

How do you make difference with tensorflow data flow processing and sklearn (if no flag) ?



2) MlFlow :
  MLflow is well maintained and full life cycle scalable.
  So, you should check their features and
  compare with them.
 
  I suggest you to write some example of typical pipeline use case : (as drawing image)
    pandas + sklearn  (ok 
    pandas + xgboost  (nok)
    Dask + Tensorflow ....
     PySpark + pytorch ....
     
  It will both you and users on the roadmap.
  

3) Idea of mapper :
   Transform existing “dirty code” (jupyter based)
into template pipeline by adding 
   #comment tag in jupyter

   Batch training of many different models
   without writing explicit code (code is generated by the JSON input).

4) If your framework has low level of 
“Boilterplate” code, adoption will be fast...

This is really interesting. And with the NonFIttableMixin, you can avoid doing fit if there is no state to acquire. State is acquired in fit. Then transform only processes.

Hi, thanks for the reply. 

> How do you make difference with tensorflow data flow processing and sklearn (if no flag) ?

It is possible to do an `if isinstance` as follow inside our `Pipeline` class to modify it: 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2225038/determine-the-type-of-an-object

This way we will not need to manually say `SKLearnWrapper` in boilerplate code. Boilerplate code won't need `SKLearnWrapper` because it will be inside. 

> 3) Idea of mapper :
> Transform existing “dirty code” (jupyter based)
> into template pipeline by adding
>    #comment tag in jupyter

Could you add more details ? Do you suggest to use magic `%%` iPython jupyter methods to wrap to flask?

>    Batch training of many different models
>    without writing explicit code (code is generated by the JSON input).

Could you give an example of JSON or link to an example? That is cool to launch training jobs from JSON calls. 

Thank you!

@arita37 We opened a pull request to fix the SKLearnWrapper issue: 
https://github.com/Neuraxio/Neuraxle/pull/160

Hello,

A) Converter Jupyter to python pipeline script
  Add comments tag ##= in jupyter :

##= pipeline.py:mypipe
   CodeJupyter


##= train.py:mytrain
   CodeJupyter






B) example of launching batch by json :
https://github.com/arita37/json_api/blob/master/mapper_sklearn.py

@arita37 This issue is fixed. We uploaded a new version 0.2.1: 
https://pypi.org/project/neuraxle/

See, it doesn't have sklearnwrappers anymore in the code, such as in the quickstart example in the README.

Thank you for your ideas. Please open more issue if you have more good ideas like this one.
